CatDescriptText: Mr. John Diggs Jr., high school senior, Sheraden and Mrs. Nannie Reddick, caterer, Brushton, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, May 26, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Should better medical care be provided for the aged through Social Security?" Mr. John Diggs Jr.'s answer reads: "I think so.  I believe that since the old people are retired and can't find work any place, the government should take care or rather help to take care of the people.  Perhaps they should pay one-half of the amount and teh Social Security pay the other half."  Mrs. Nannie Reddick's answer reads: "Yes, indeed, and I say this because my parents themselves are up in age and requiring care.  Generally speaking, all persons in this category, need some assistance and should have medical care.  This helps them to keep going and to keep from being shut-ins..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Diggs Jr. wearing two toned polo shirt and light colored letterman sweater, standing in front of street with SUN drug store, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Nannie Reddick wearing short sleeve crisscrossed dress with fringed tie at collar, standing in front of SUN drug store, corner of Liberty Avenue and Olga Way, Downtown
